newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Silver Grant up after share issue plan.
newsitem.headline: Silver Grant up after share issue plan.

text.p: Silver Grant International Industries Ltd rose on Tuesday after resuming trading after a suspension pending a share placement.
The stock, suspended on Friday, rose HK$0.225 to HK$2.90.
The property leasing and investment holding company said its parent Join Truth Ltd will place 36 million existing shares it owns in the company with institutional investors at HK$2.525 per share.
Joint Truth in turn would subscribe to 36 million new Silver Grant shares, representing 16.5 percent of the company's enlarged share capital, at the same price.
Silver Grant said the deal would dilute Joint Truth's interest in the company to 53.9 percent from 64.5 percent.

It said the proceeds would be used to fund its recent indirect investment in Jiangxi Copper Co Ltd, a direct investment in a retail management joint venture with Beijing Wanfujing Department Store (Group) Co Ltd and for working capital.
